oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Higher Toda brackets and the Adams spectral sequence in triangulated categories
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Christensen, J. Daniel
Frankland, Martin
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Algebraic Topology
Mathematics - Category Theory
55T15 (Primary) 18E30, 55S20, 18G25 (Secondary)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Adams spectral sequence is available in any triangulated category equipped with a projective or injective class. Higher Toda brackets can also be defined in a triangulated category, as observed by B. Shipley based on J. Cohen's approach for spectra. We provide a family of definitions of higher Toda brackets, show that they are equivalent to Shipley's, and show that they are self-dual. Our main result is that the Adams differential $d_r$ in any Adams spectral sequence can be expressed as an $(r+1)$-fold Toda bracket and as an $r^{\text{th}}$ order cohomology operation. We also show how the result simplifies under a sparseness assumption, discuss several examples, and give an elementary proof of a result of Heller, which implies that the three-fold Toda brackets in principle determine the higher Toda brackets.
